data.title: Affordable Bus tickets to Stuttgart

data.text:
Things to do in Stuttgart

About Stuttgart

When Your bus arrives to Stuttgart You can visit its downtown, situated between the main station and Koenigstrasse. Then You can take a gentle stroll or explore some of the many shops that Stuttgart has to offer. True to Swabian thrift You can enjoy some bargain hunting or stop off at one of Stuttgart’s bars or restaurants before Your bus takes You home again. Stuttgart has many suburbs which are easily accessible by bus and will also offer You many shopping and dining opportunities.

Places of Interest in Stuttgart

Stuttgart is often referred to as being a “motor city” as it is the home of the Mercedes-Benz and Porsche Head Quarters. The Mercedes-Benz museum in Stuttgart has attracted visitors for many years and displays 120 years of the car industry’s finest history, displaying over 160 different vehicles.

As soon as Your bus arrives to Stuttgart the television tower, standing at a staggering 217 meters, can be seen almost immediately in and amongst the city’s skyline. As far as architectural significance is concerned, it is well known outside of the borders of Baden-Wuerttemberg. Currently the tower is closed off to visitors; fortunately there are many other alternatives to visit, including the Railway Station Tower, the Bismark Tower or the Killesberg Tower.

Culture and History of Stuttgart

If You are looking for a cultural getaway, this Swabian metropolis is the perfect destination. The city’s gallery has a large collection of paintings with a vast amount of frequently changing exhibitions, making it one of the most popular museums in Germany. When visiting the gallery perhaps You can see one of the collection’s from Your favorite artist. You can be sure that at the end of Your culture filled day we will get You from A to B at an unbelievably low price! For our passengers who are interested in Natural History then a visit to the Natural History Museum (Naturkundemuseum) is a must. If You would like to see some great architecture then be sure to spend Your morning taking a stroll through the Old Castle or the New Palace. Then You can spend Your afternoon at Schillerplatz where there are countless culinary delights as well as the weekly market, the Christmas markets and the Stuttgart wine village.

Interesting Facts about Stuttgart

At the Canstatter Wasen you will find (sport) stadiums and arenas that not only host a variety of concerts throughout the year but also one of the most famous festivals in southern Germany. This spring time festival takes place every year around April/May time and means that Your bus travel to Stuttgart will offer You many show booths, events and fair rides. Choosing the right bus travel to Stuttgart means that You can enjoy a stress free trip to one of Germany’s biggest and best festivals! After all of this hustle and bustle You can enjoy take some time to relax in one of Stuttgart’s beautiful parks, gardens or forests. You will find that there is no place in Stuttgart which is any further than 1.5km away from a park. Directly in the western and southern parts of the city there are an extensive amount of forests such as the “Rot- and Schwarzwildpark.”

Surrounding Areas of Stuttgart

If You like culture and would like to relax in a park before or after Your bus travel then You can spend time in one of the surrounding areas of one of Stuttgart’s many castles. Amongst these castles You will find the Old Church (Alten Schloss) from the 10th Century and the New Palace (Neuen Schloss) which is next to the famous “Jubilaeumssaeule.” Throughout Stuttgart You will find many impressive historical attractions which are all located in areas where You enjoy the sights in the countryside!
